page.title: 04COMMUNICATIONS:WOODTON AREA
page.content: Some 95% of the dwellings here have a telephone,15% of these,mainly farms & other businesses have 2 or more.There is a reasonable postal service.The post is collected weekdays mid-morning & afternoon,& there is a morning delivery,but no Sunday collection. Daily papers & magazines are sold & delivered by the owners of the village shop;Sunday papers by a person from outside the area,& a few have their periodicals by post.Each month a free news-sheet from the Hempnall Group of parishes is given to every family in Woodton.This has news of church & local affairs,including baptisms, marriages & burials. A mobile{library}from Norfolk County service visits villages monthly.It brings a selection of books,which the librarian has learnt will be of interest,& people may order others.
